Abstract
Construction of an all-solid-state artificial Z-scheme system consisting of Bi 2 WO 6 AuCdS nanostructure for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction into renewable hydrocarbon fuelView the table of contents for this issue, or go to the journal homepage for more
Experimental

In the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 in a gas-solid reaction system, 0.1 g of the as-prepared sample was uniformly dispersed on the circular glass reactor with an area of 4.2 cm 2 .A 300 W Xe lamp was used as the light source for the photoreduction.The volume of the reaction system was about 230 ml.The reaction setup was vacuum-treated several times, and then the high purity of CO 2 gas was maintained in the reaction setup for reaching ambient pressure.0.4 ml of deionized water was injected into the

O 2 may be produced.As the main intention of our work focuses on the generation of the hydrocarbon fuel, H 2 and O 2 were not checked.The CO 2 photocatalytic activity of various Bi 2 WO 6based photocatalysts was evaluated with visible light illumination (400 nm) in the presence of water vapor. (figure 8).The CH 4 generation rate of Bi 2 WO 6 was detected at about 0.41 mol g -1 in the first hour.Loading Au nanoparticles on the Bi 2 WO 6 nanoplate to form the Bi 2 WO 6 Au increased the CH 4 generation rate

is deduced that the present Bi 2 WO 6 and CdS may form a typical type-II heterostructure (figure 9(a)), consistent with previous reports of Bi 2 WO 6 -CdS nanocomposites 47.The visible-light generated electron of the CdS transferred from the CB of CdS to the CB of Bi 2 WO 6 , while the photoinduced hole of CdS remained in the VB of CdS for oxidation of water, which simultaneously leads to photocorrosion of CdS.The Bi 2 WO 6 AuCdS exhibits a CH 4 generation rate of 2.02 mol g -1 , increasing by four times

of incident photons in unit time, respectively.The apparent quantum yield at a wavelength of 43015 nm was measured to be 0.012.This similar CdS-based photocatalytic Z-scheme system has been reported in CdSAuZnO, CdSAuTiO 2 24,49,50, CdSAuTiO 1.96 C 0.04 51 and CdSAg Bi 2 MoO 6 52.Although Au nanoparticles can exhibit a surface plasmon resonance (SPR) effect, it is believed that the contribution of the SPR to the photocatalytic efficiency is relative limited, compared to the semiconductor.Photoluminescence

evidence.pdf_reference: In the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 in a gas-solid reaction system, 0.1 g of the as-prepared sample was uniformly dispersed on the circular glass reactor with an area of 4.2 cm 2 .A 300 W Xe lamp was used as the light source for the photoreduction.The volume of the reaction system was about 230 ml.The reaction setup was vacuum-treated several times, and then the high purity of CO 2 gas was maintained in the reaction setup for reaching ambient pressure.0.4 ml of deionized water was injected into the

water was injected into the reaction system as a reducer.The sample was allowed to equilibrate in the CO 2 -H 2 O atmosphere for several hours to ensure that the adsorption of gas molecules was completed.During the irradiation, 1 ml of gas was continually taken from the reaction cell at given time intervals for subsequent CH 4 concentration analysis by using a gas chromatograph (GC-2014, Shimadzu Corp., Japan).

followed by a water bath under stirring at 60 C for 30 min.The product was then centrifuged, washed with deionized water and absolute ethanol several times, and dried by lyophilization. The morphology of the samples was characterized by field emission scanning electron microscopy (FE-SEM) (FEI NOVA NanoSEM230, USA) and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) (JEOL 3010, Japan).The crystallographic phase of these obtained products was determined by powder x-ray diffraction (XRD) with Cu-Ka radiation
